- Two Pair: 10s and 8s

Let me calculate what I can score:

**Option 1: Two Pair (10s and 8s) - positions 1, 4, 7, 8**
- Base chips: 80 (Level 4)
- Card chips: 10 + 10 + 8 + 8 = 36


- Blue Joker adds 46 chips, bringing the total to 162 chips before multiplier. Since Two Pair hasn't been played yet this round, Card Sharp won't trigger. With a base multiplier of 5, this scores 810 chips.

After playing Two Pair, the Boss Blind will downgrade it to Level 3. If I can form it again with my second hand, I'd be working with 55 base chips at the reduced level, plus whatever card values I draw, and roughly 40 from the Blue Joker. That would give me around 95 chips before applying the 4x multiplier.

However, Card Sharp would activate on the second play since Two Pair was already played this round, multiplying by 3 for a total of 12x. This second Two Pair would yield approximately 1,140 chips. Combined with the first play, that's 1,950 chips total—bringing my score to 5,046 chips, which still falls short of the target.

I should explore other hand possibilities. Looking at my cards—10, 9 of Spades, Jack of Hearts, 10 of Hearts, 4 of Hearts, Ace of Clubs, 8 of Clubs, 8 of Diamonds, 3 of Diamonds, 2 of Diamonds—I could potentially form a straight if I can find five consecutive ranks. ,000 chips, which combined with current 3,096 = 8,096 - still not enough!

Wait, I already played a Full House this round, so Card Sharp activates on a repeat. First Full House nets 2,832 chips, and the second one at Level 4 with the Card Sharp multiplier gives 6,480 chips, totaling 9,312. That brings me to 12,408 chips combined - enough to win. The challenge is whether I can actually construct another Full House with my remaining cards.

I have two 10s and two 8s, needing one more card to complete a three-of-a-kind. The deck still has two 8s available but no more 10s, so drawing another 8 is possible but unlikely with only 23 cards remaining. Alternatively, I notice I'm holding Jack, 10, 9, and 8 - if I draw a 7, I'd complete a straight. Three 7s are still in the deck, making that a more probable outcome than getting the third 8.

A straight would score 480 chips with my current setup, which still falls short. My best path forward is pursuing a Full House by keeping my pair of 10s and pair of 8s, then discarding the lower cards to draw into a third matching card.

I'll keep the 10s, 8s, and Ace, discarding the 9, Jack, 4, 3, and 2. That gives me five cards to discard and a chance to hit either another 10 or 8 to complete the Full House.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
